title: High Total Reserves
description: In 2023, Algeria's total reserves were 1110.24% of its total external debt, indicating a strong financial buffer against external shocks.

title: Complete Reliance on Fossil Fuels
description: As of 2022, 100% of Algeria's energy consumption was derived from fossil fuels, highlighting a lack of diversification in energy sources.

title: Strong Youth Literacy Gender Parity
description: In 2019, Algeria achieved a youth literacy gender parity index of 1.23, indicating balanced educational opportunities for young males and females.

title: Minimal Market Capitalization
description: In 2018, the market capitalization of listed domestic companies in Algeria was only 0.19% of GDP, suggesting limited stock market development.

title: Low IBRD Loans and IDA Credits
description: In 2016, Algeria's IBRD loans and IDA credits stood at $725,000, reflecting minimal reliance on international financial institutions for development.

title: Efficient Debt Service Management
description: In 2023, public and publicly guaranteed debt service was only 0.19% of exports, indicating effective debt management relative to export earnings.

title: Limited Primary Education Expenditure
description: In 2023, only 1.40% of total expenditure in primary public institutions was allocated to current education expenditure, suggesting underinvestment in primary education.
